misdeed: A wave of despair has gripped a small village nestled in a mist-shrouded valley.  People report hearing the mournful cries of a child echoing through the night, and a palpable sense of dread hangs heavy in the air.
solution: The Vaesen is a Myling and can be put to rest by finding its body, burying it in consecrated ground, and giving it someone elseâ€™s name.

clues.description: The cries seem to emanate from the vicinity of the village graveyard, particularly after a fresh grave has been dug.
Villagers report seeing a shadowy figure, small and indistinct, flitting through the graveyard at dusk.
The village dogs whine and refuse to enter the graveyard, their fur bristling with fear.
An old woman recounts a local legend of a young mother who, driven mad by grief, took her own child's life and buried it in unconsecrated ground.
A small, crudely stitched doll is found abandoned on the steps of the village church, its button eyes seeming to stare accusingly.
The villagers discover a hidden alcove in the graveyard wall, containing a pile of tiny bones and a tattered scrap of a child's clothing.

plotTwist.description: The village priest, haunted by a past sin involving an unbaptized child, unwittingly awakened the Vaesen while attempting to atone for his actions.
